channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Protruding bell, 23rd February
item.description:
The metal bell is protruding from St Paul's road and is dark in colour making it very hard to see in dark and wet conditions.

item.title: Dunstall house marmont Road, 23rd February
item.description:
This is not fly tipping. Just normal household waste. This is not getting better. There are not enough bins. This will be picked up by the council worker this morning. Placed in the bins. The bins will be full again. This is on repeat every day. The rubbish has been here all weekend like this. On Sunday a local man collected the detritus from the bins on Marmont Road which blows around. This is a health hazard and eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Staffordshire Street, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pots holes getting deep and dangerous, 23rd February
item.description:
Hi The entrance road to BPP and and our houses are getting very deep, numerous and dangerous . We need them all repaired again please or ideally a complete road resurface with some quality materials please. There are many pot holes along the first stretch of road up to Y junction at least, the whole section needs re surveying gain pleasssssse . Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Place Park, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
